corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Multiformat materials primarily representing the documentation and analysis of the folklore of regions of New York, New Jersey (particularly the New Jersey Pinelands region), Kentucky, Pennsylvania, Indiana, and Alaska by folklorist Herbert Halpert from the 1930s to 1950s.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Herbert Halpert collection was processed by Judy Ng, Carl Fleischhauer, Marcia K. Segal, and Michael Taft between 2004 and 2023. Photographic materials were processed by Carl Fleischhauer. Michael Taft assigned AFS numbers to sound discs.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Herbert Halpert collection is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Herbert Halpert collection (AFC 2004/008), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Herbert Halpert was born in New York City, August 23, 1911. He studied folklore and anthropology for his M.A. from Columbia University. During the New Deal he recorded extensive collections of folk music, songs, and tales in New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and across the South for the Federal Theatre Project, the Joint Committee on Folk Arts of the Works Projects Administration (WPA), and the Library of Congress. He received his Ph.D. from Indiana University in 1942. He founded the Memorial University of Newfoundland Folklore and Language Archive (MUNFLA), and taught at the University for many years. Halpert died December 29, 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings, correspondence, indexes, manuscripts, research notes, music transcriptions, photographs and photographic negatives, newspaper clippings, student papers, ephemera and other materials primarily representing the documentation and analysis of the folklore of regions of New York; New Jersey, particularly the New Jersey Pinelands region; Kentucky; Pennsylvania; Indiana; and Alaska by folklorist Herbert Halpert from the 1930s to 1950s. Includes publications edited by Herbert Halpert issued by the National Service Bureau of the WPA Federal Theater Project in New York City. Topics of Halpert's research included folk songs, folk belief, tales, legends, customs, and folklife. Includes photographs of interviewees and landscapes from the 1930s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Herbert Halpert collection is organized in 5 series:

The photographic materials are listed in approximately the order in which they are housed within each folder. This series was processed by Carl Fleischhauer. Photo titles/captions were developed by Carl Fleischhauer and Marcia Segal, based on available information. Three photos are historic in nature, and believed to have been provided to Halpert by the informants. All others are the result of Halpert's own fieldwork.
